means: 撤回（声明），放弃（信仰或主张）

sentence.Network_en: White House officials ordered Williams to recant.
sentence.Network_cn: 白宫官员命令威廉斯公开宣布放弃自己的观点。

sentence.Network_en: Though he was forced to change his religion,he would not recant.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然强迫他改变宗教信仰，但他绝不改变。

sentence.Network_en: However, life would be pleasanter if Rhett would recant his heresies.
sentence.Network_cn: 不过,如果瑞德放其他的那套异端邪说, 生活就会惬意得多.

PerfectNetExp.abs: cant术语；暗语（唱出来的话→暗语）recant撤消；accent口音；重音
1. 简述要旨recant 取消,撤回recede 后退
...calcitrant/refractory:authority=reactionary:changerecant vi. 放弃信仰,撤消声明,公开认错to withdraw or repudiate (a statement or belief) f.

list.abs: Unless you recant your confession , you will be punished severely ., 除非你收回你的供词 , 你将严厉惩罚.
because if you have no beliefs to recant , then what ? .你没有信仰可以放弃，那么？
What if I had to get you recant ?, 如果我不得不让你放弃信仰?
unless you recant your confession , you will be punished severely .除非你收回你的供词，你将严厉惩罚。
thousands of members were forced to recant or suffer torture and death in labour camps .上千名会员被迫放弃信仰，或在劳改营中遭受酷刑和死去。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from Latin recantare 'revoke', from re- (expressing 'reversal') + cantare 'sing, chant'

entry.def: If you recant, you say publicly that you no longer hold a set of beliefs that you had in the past.

example.ex: White House officials ordered Williams to recant.
example.tran: 白宫官员命令威廉斯公开宣布放弃自己的观点。

example.ex: ...a man who had refused after torture to recant his heresy.
example.tran: 受严刑折磨后仍拒绝放弃其异教信仰的人

means.word_mean: 1. formally reject or disavow a formerly held belief, usually under pressure;

sentences.sentence: "He retracted his earlier statements about his religion"

auth_sentence.content: Twice he offered to recant and then withdrew the offer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Twice he offered to recant and then withdrew the offer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Twice he offered to recant and then withdrew the offer.

auth_sentence.content: Yet by early December, the British Embassy was starting to recant.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yet by early December, the British Embassy was starting to recant.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yet by early December, the British Embassy was starting to recant.

auth_sentence.content: Some were imprisoned or tortured, others beaten and made to recant.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some were imprisoned or tortured, others beaten and made to recant.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some were imprisoned or tortured, others beaten and made to recant.

stems_affixes.word_buile: cant[n.术语;暗语]+ata表示音乐类→n.清唱剧
cant唱,歌+o音乐术语→唱的诗歌
cant怠鷑.吟唱;反复的大声说 v.吟唱;反复说
cant怠鷑.吟唱;反复的大声说 v.吟唱;反复说
